intro: Plexipus insularis, commonly known as the island spurge, is a flowering plant native to certain tropical regions. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous perennial, featuring broad, lance-shaped leaves and small, clustered yellow flowers. Its growth habit is often low to the ground, with a tendency to spread through rhizomes. The plant is adapted to well-drained soils and full sun, making it a common sight in coastal and island habitats.
